definitions.definition: To spend the winter in a dormant or inactive state of minimal activity, low body temperature , slow breathing and heart rate , and low metabolic rate ; to go through a winter sleep .
examples: Hedgehogs and bears are two of the many mammals that hibernate in winter.

definitions.definition: To enter a standby state which conserves power without losing the contents of memory .

main_definition: ( intransitive , biology ) To spend the winter in a dormant or inactive state of minimal activity, low body temperature , slow breathing and heart rate , and low metabolic rate ; to go through a winter sleep .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , computing ) To enter a standby state which conserves power without losing the contents of memory .
